separatedSuspendSales.tooltip: If you enable this , Suspend sales will not considering to all sales value. Suspend sales values will calculating saparately. Suspend sales will not effected to Profit Lost Report.

Credit Management
Disable Sales if there is a due for customer, cant do paid new sale also. Message will popup for settlement Disable Credit Sales.if there is a due for customer, cant do credit new sale also. Message will popup for settlement

enableEditing.tooltip: If enabled product purchase price and selling price will be updated after a purchase is added or updated

enablePurchase.label: Enable Purchase Status
enablePurchase.tooltip: On disable all purchases will be marked as Item Received

enableSupplier.label: Enable Supplier Bill No. for Purchase Invoices
enableSupplier.tooltip: When enabled, you will get a field for entering Supplier Bill No.

enableLot.label: Enable Lot number
enableLot.tooltip: This will enable you to enter Lot number for each purchase line in purchase screen

enableLastLot.label: Enable Last Lot Show Option
enableLastLot.tooltip: If this setting is enabled, the lot number of the invoice will be shown on the purchase screen.

enableLotNumberAuto.label: Enable Lot Number Auto Generation
enableLotNumberAuto.tooltip: Enable Lot Number Auto Generation Mode.

enableLotNumberUnique.label: Lot Number is Unique for the Business
enableLotNumberUnique.tooltip: If not Lot Number is Unique for the Product

removeMinus.label: Remove Minus Quantity
removeMinus.tooltip: Disable Minus Quantity adding option from all sections.( Purchase order/ sales/ opening stock/ stock transfer/ stock adjustment)

amountSpend.label: Amount Spend for Unit Point
amountSpend.tooltip: Meaning how much the customer spent to get one reward points.Example: If you set it as 10, then for every $10 spent by customer they will get one reward points. If the customer purchases for $1000 then they will get 100 reward points.

minimumOrder.label: Minimum Order Total to Earn Reward
minimumOrder.tooltip:
The minimum amount the customer should spend to get reward points. Example: If you set it as 100 then customer will get reward points only if there invoice total is greater or equal to 100. If invoice total is 99 then they wont get any reward points.

You can set it as minimum 1.

maximumPoints.label: Maximum Points per Order
maximumPoints.tooltip:
The minimum amount the customer should spend to get reward points. Example: If you set it as 100 then customer will get reward points only if there invoice total is greater or equal to 100. If invoice total is 99 then they wont get any reward points.

You can set it as minimum 1.

redeemAmount.label: Redeem Amount per Unit Point
redeemAmount.tooltip: It indicates the redeem amount per point.For example:If 1 point is $1 then enter the value as 1. If 2 points is $1 then enter the value as 0.50

minimumOrderTotal.label: Minimum Order Total to Redeem Point
minimumOrderTotal.tooltip: Minimum order total for which customers can redeem points. Leave it blank if you dont need this restriction or you need to give something for free.

minimumRedeemPoint.label: Minimum Redeem Point
minimumRedeemPoint.tooltip: Minimum redeem points that can be used per invoice. Leave it blank if you dont need this restriction.

maximumedeemPoint.label: Maximum Redeem Point per Order
maximumedeemPoint.tooltip: Maximum points that can be used in one order. Leave it blank if you dont need this restriction.

rewardPointExpiry.label: Reward Point Expiry Period
rewardPointExpiry.tooltip: Expiry period for points earned by customer.You can set it in months or year. Expired points will get deducted from customer account automatically after this period.

smPosDefault.label: SM-POS as Default
smPosDefault.tooltip: is enable POS dropdown default as SMPOS else POS

saleType.tooltip: Fixed commission calculation for use this sale type module
